answers.answer: You are doing the right things by dieting and losing weight. We like Sugarbusters and South Beach, because of the lower carb issues. We also use insulin sensitizers like pioglitazone and metformin to get the fat out of the liver before we re treat someone like you. You may want to ask your MD about that. Good luck and congrats on the weight loss!DTD

question: Hey, welcome to the busiest board in the group, I bet.I tried Pegasys tx in 2002 with viral breakthru at 30 weeks...lost about 40 lbs but have since gained it back.  I'm going to the gym and have RADICALLY changed the way I eat......but have a question.........when NASH is combined with Hep C, how much more scared should I be as far as the condition of my liver?  I'm dieting and exercising...and the pounds are going away very slowly (five pounds in two months) , but should I be working harder?  No diabetes type 2...never been a drinker....other than having hep c, i have no health issues.Are there any symptoms of NASH?  My last biopsy showed something like 20%....my doc was pretty laid back about it, but he's pretty laid back about everything, so I got busy myself.  Just wondering if I am on the right track, he didn't really have any advice.Willow
